title: Wipro CEO Thierry Delaporte quits, to be replaced by Americas chief Srini Pallia
description: Srinivas Pallia, who was the CEO for the company's Americas 1 area, will take over as the new CEO and Managing Director from April 7, the company added.
content: Wipro, which has trailed Tata Consultancy Services, Infosys and HCLTech over the past few years through a tortuous and incomplete turnaround, said late Saturday that its first expatriate chief executive Thierry Delaporte was leaving.Srini Pallia, a company veteran of three decades, will take over the role at the erstwhile top-three software bellwether which lost the spot to HCL Technologies a few years ago.Delaporte, the first European executive to lead Wipro that began six decades ago as a maker of vegetable soaps and consumer goods, will seek “to pursue passions outside the workplace”, said the company. Pallia, the Americas head of Wipro, will take charge April 7 for five years. Delaporte will stay on until May-end to help with the transition, the company said.The sudden announcement came after a closed-door meeting of Wipro’s key board members on Saturday, ET has learnt.Exodus of Senior Leadership
